svg.content: <mxfile host="Electron" modified="2020-12-23T04:34:49.625Z" agent="5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) draw.io/13.9.9 Chrome/85.0.4183.121 Electron/10.1.5 Safari/537.36" etag="-FCi8feQH7A_f7Qtlvbq" version="13.9.9" type="device" pages="8"><diagram name="current solution" id="jo_tqqaoXcJ4pL3CvruL"></diagram><diagram name="two-standby-sync" id="YWiQ7VtlOqwspf-bPmPy"></diagram><diagram name="three-standby-one-async" id="YXmRyaHMAbgkGmFHiaTg"></diagram><diagram id="AZIMW8cEEWnOwXJt-rv6" name="Monitor SPOF Solution"></diagram><diagram name="Monitor Failover Timing diagram" id="1K1uAkkorU9uBAw3Ydq_"></diagram><diagram name="pgafo arch optimization" id="JXaiqHxTO0N4fEMFYyH5"></diagram><diagram id="ryRn8KS3qAcLADxoevrt" name="Failover State Machine"></diagram><diagram id="3LhDqdMSCVspdOKtFAWk" name="auto-HA node states"></diagram></mxfile>

div.div:
the transitions marked + are never
taken by the monitor but might be
experienced by the primary if it is down
for a while and never checks in to notice
that it's supposed to be in "draining",for example

if primary loses contact
with the other nodes
